metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（大满超级站物候相机观测数据集-2020）
metadata.description:
The dataset contains the phenological camera observation data of the Daman Superstation in the midstream of Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020. The instrument was developed and data processed by Beijing Normal University. The phenomenon camera integrates data acquisition and data transmission functions. The camera captures data by look-downward with a resolution of 1280×720. For the calculation of the phenology, firstly, the phenological index needs to be calculated according to the region of interest. Such as, the relative greenness index (GCC, Green Chromatic Coordinate, calculated by GCC=G/(R+G+B)). Then, controlling the quality of data, filling the invalid value and filtering smoothing are performed. Finally, the key phenological parameters are determined according to the growth curve fitting, such as the growth season start date, peak, growth season end, etc. This data set includes the relative greenness index (GCC) in 2020.
Please refer to Liu et al. (2018) for sites information in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含2020年1月1日至2010年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游大满超级站的物候相机观测数据，该仪器由北京师范大学自主研发并进行处理。物候相机集成数据获取与数据传输功能。相机采用垂直向下的方式采集数据，拍摄数据分辨率为1280*720，可指定拍摄时间频率。对于物候期的计算，首先，根据感兴趣区计算物候指标，如相对绿度指数(GCC, Green Chromatic Coordinate公式为GCC=G/(R+G+B), R、G、B为图像红、绿、蓝三通道像元值)。然后对数据进行质量控制、无效值填充和滤波平滑。最后根据生长曲线拟合确定关键物候期参数，如生长季起始日、顶峰、生长季结束日等。本数据集为该站点2020年相对绿度指数（GCC）。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，这些数据集包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括HRB的中下游，位于中国西部的干旱地区，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to observe phenological changes in arid and semiarid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于观察干旱和半干旱地区物候变化的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method involves using a phenological camera designed to capture images vertically downward, with a resolution of 1280*720. The method includes specifying the shooting frequency and calculating phenological indices such as the relative greenness index (GCC) from the images.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及使用一种表型相机，旨在垂直向下拍摄，分辨率为1280*720。该方法包括指定拍摄频率和从图像中计算表型指数，如相对绿色指数（GCC）。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting environmental data in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域收集环境数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in collecting data in these regions includes ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, particularly in areas along the Silk Road like the Tarim River basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在这些地区收集数据的一个挑战包括生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧，以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在丝绸之路沿线的塔里木河流域。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能源、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据集的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is one consisting of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, alongside hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, collected from 2012 to 2021 in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB in western China, freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是由2012年至2021年在中国西部的黄河中下游地区收集的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数，数据可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'phenocam observation dataset' mean in the context of surface process observation networks?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在地表过程观测网络的背景下，“phenocam观测数据集”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: A 'phenocam observation dataset' refers to data collected using a phenology camera, which captures images to monitor vegetation changes over time. In the context of surface process observation networks, this involves using cameras installed vertically to gather high-resolution images at specified frequencies. The images are processed to calculate phenological indices such as the Relative Greenness Index (GCC), which is used to determine key phenological parameters like the start and end of the growing season.
Definition.AnswerCn: “表型相机观测数据集”是指使用表型相机收集的数据，该相机捕捉图像以监测植被随时间的变化。在表面过程观测网络的背景下，这涉及到安装垂直相机以在指定频率下收集高分辨率图像。这些图像经过处理以计算表型指数，如相对绿度指数（GCC），用于确定关键的表型参数，如生长季节的开始和结束。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is 'eddy covariance system' as a data collection method in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 什么是涡度协方差系统作为绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的数据收集方法？
Definition.AnswerEn: An 'eddy covariance system' is a method used to measure and analyze turbulent fluxes of energy, water vapor, and carbon dioxide between the land surface and atmosphere. In oasis–desert ecosystems, this system is employed to gather half-hourly data on these fluxes, providing insights into energy, water, and carbon exchanges that are crucial for understanding ecological interactions and carbon balance.
Definition.AnswerCn: “涡度协方差系统”是一种用于测量和分析陆地表面与大气之间能量、水蒸气和二氧化碳的湍流通量的方法。在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，该系统被用来收集半小时的数据，提供关于这些通量的见解，这对于理解生态相互作用和碳平衡至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'data quality control' entail in the context of hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“数据质量控制”包括哪些内容？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of hydrometeorological data collection, 'data quality control' involves processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of collected data. This includes quality checks, filling in missing or invalid values, and applying filters to smooth the data. These steps are critical in maintaining the integrity of datasets that include variables like radiation, soil heat flux, and meteorological parameters.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“数据质量控制”涉及确保收集数据的准确性和可靠性的过程。这包括质量检查、填补缺失或无效值，以及应用滤波器平滑数据。这些步骤对于维护包括辐射、土壤热通量和气象参数等变量的数据集的完整性至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges faced in maintaining data accuracy in the inland river basins of arid regions compare to those in managing oasis–desert ecosystem datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的内陆河流流域维护数据准确性所面临的挑战与管理绿洲-沙漠生态系统数据集所面临的挑战相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face challenges such as ecological degradation, which may affect data accuracy, while oasis–desert ecosystems require careful monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges to ensure data accuracy and support ecological security, emphasizing the importance of long-term observations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化等挑战，这可能影响数据的准确性，而绿洲-沙漠生态系统需要仔细监测能量、水汽和碳的交换，以确保数据的准确性并支持生态安全，强调了长期观测的重要性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What data collection methods could be inferred to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 为了在可持续发展中维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡，可以推断出哪些数据收集方法？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve acquiring long-term observational datasets consisting of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data such as hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, using tools like eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及获取长期观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及辅助数据，如水文气象、植被和土壤参数，使用的工具包括涡度协方差系统和自动气象站。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange datasets are essential for supporting ecological security and sustainable development in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 支持绿洲-沙漠生态系统生态安全和可持续发展的能量、水汽和碳交换数据集的关键特征是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Essential characteristics include robust data processing and quality control, encompassing data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing, as well as the inclusion of detailed parameters such as radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, and vegetation and soil parameters.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 基本特征包括强大的数据处理和质量控制，涵盖数据收集、处理、存档和共享，以及包括辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面以及植被和土壤参数等详细参数。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in maintaining the ecological balance between oasis and desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间生态平衡的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in maintaining the ecological balance between oasis and desert systems are due to the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, particularly in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间生态平衡的挑战，源于生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及尘暴的频繁发生，尤其是在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to have long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行长期观察的重要性是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are important in oasis–desert ecosystems to achieve a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and is significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观察在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中非常重要，以实现对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using phenology cameras for data collection on the accuracy and completeness of vegetation growth cycle observations in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用物候相机进行数据收集对干旱地区植被生长周期观察的准确性和完整性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using phenology cameras can provide detailed temporal resolution and accuracy in observing vegetation growth cycles by capturing data at specified time frequencies and resolutions. This method allows for precise calculation of phenological indicators such as the Green Chromatic Coordinate (GCC), which can enhance the understanding and monitoring of key growth parameters like the start and end of the growing season, thus improving the accuracy of vegetation observations in arid regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用物候相机可以通过在指定的时间频率和分辨率下捕捉数据，提供详细的时间分辨率和准确性，以观察植被生长周期。这种方法允许精确计算物候指标，如绿色色度坐标（GCC），从而增强对关键生长参数的理解和监测，例如生长季节的开始和结束，从而提高干旱地区植被观察的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the implications of climate change on the data collected from inland river basins in arid areas with regards to ecological environment degradation?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 气候变化对干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化的数据收集可能产生什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The data collected from inland river basins in arid areas can reflect the impacts of climate change on ecological environments, such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, and intensified desertification. These changes may be exacerbated by climate change, leading to an increased frequency of dust storms and other ecological crises. Long-term observational datasets are crucial to understanding these trends and developing strategies to mitigate negative impacts.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 从干旱地区内陆河流流域收集的数据可以反映气候变化对生态环境的影响，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化以及沙漠化加剧。这些变化可能因气候变化而加剧，导致沙尘暴和其他生态危机的发生频率增加。长期的观测数据集对于理解这些趋势和制定减轻负面影响的策略至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind collecting long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems, particularly concerning energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集长期观测数据集的目标是什么，特别是关于能量、水汽和碳交换的目标？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goal is to achieve a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems to recognize the interactions within these systems. This understanding is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in these areas. It also supports the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality and ensures ecological security.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是实现对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，以认识这些系统内部的相互作用。这种理解对于维持生态稳定和支持这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。它还支持碳达峰和碳中和的目标，并确保生态安全。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to address challenges in data collection within arid and semiarid regions, especially for ecosystems in inland river basins?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱和半干旱地区，特别是内陆河流域的生态系统中解决数据收集的挑战很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Arid and semiarid regions, particularly inland river basins, face ecological degradation challenges like drying rivers and intensified desertification. Addressing these challenges is essential to mitigate environmental degradation, support ecological restoration, and maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems, which is vital for ecological and socioeconomic stability.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 干旱和半干旱地区，特别是内陆河流流域，面临着生态退化的挑战，如河流干涸和沙漠化加剧。应对这些挑战对于减缓环境退化、支持生态恢复以及维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，这对生态和社会经济的稳定具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why does the collection of half-hourly turbulent flux data from oasis–desert systems utilize both eddy covariance systems and scintillometers?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集半小时的湍流通量数据时同时使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The use of both eddy covariance systems and scintillometers aims to obtain a comprehensive and accurate representation of the energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. This dual approach enhances the reliability of data collection and helps in capturing the complex interactions in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is critical for understanding and managing these environments.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的目的是获得能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的全面和准确的表征。这种双重方法增强了数据收集的可靠性，并有助于捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的复杂相互作用，这对于理解和管理这些环境至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumental techniques are applied to gather energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，收集能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据所应用的仪器技术有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis–desert systems are gathered using a combination of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers. These instruments provide half-hourly turbulent flux data. Moreover, automatic weather stations supply supplementary hydrometeorological data, which include radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, and gradients of air temperature and humidity among other parameters.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的组合收集的。这些仪器提供半小时的湍流通量数据。此外，自动气象站提供补充的水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面以及空气温度和湿度的梯度等参数。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are followed to ensure data quality in long-term observations of oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保对绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观察数据质量所遵循的程序步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data quality in long-term observations of oasis–desert ecosystems is ensured through a structured process that includes data collection, processing, and archiving. The procedure involves acquiring data from various instruments, applying data processing techniques to handle raw measurements, and employing quality control measures such as filling gaps and smoothing data. Finally, the processed data is archived and shared for broader accessibility.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 长时间观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统的数据质量通过一个结构化的过程得以保证，该过程包括数据收集、处理和归档。该程序涉及从各种仪器获取数据，应用数据处理技术来处理原始测量值，并采用质量控制措施，如填补缺失值和数据平滑。最后，处理后的数据被归档并共享，以便更广泛的访问。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and resources are necessary to maintain long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维持长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测所需的条件和资源是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial, requiring a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, including energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. The presence of an eddy covariance system and scintillometer is also necessary.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 长期观测至关重要，需要来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的一系列观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。还需要配备涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do advancements in phenological camera technology enable the precise calculation of key phenological parameters in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 先进的物候相机技术如何能够精确计算干旱地区的关键物候参数？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The phenological camera, developed by Beijing Normal University, integrates data acquisition and transmission functionalities, capturing images at a resolution of 1280x720. It enables the calculation of phenological indicators such as the Green Chromatic Coordinate (GCC) by processing images through quality control, invalid value filling, and filtering to determine key phenological parameters like growth season start and end dates.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 由北京师范大学开发的物候相机集成了数据采集和传输功能，能够以1280x720的分辨率捕捉图像。它通过质量控制、无效值填充和过滤处理图像，从而计算出诸如绿色色度坐标（GCC）等物候指标，以确定关键的物候参数，如生长季节的开始和结束日期。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological and methodological developments support the integration and sharing of hydrometeorological and flux data in arid inland river basins?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 支持干旱内陆河流流域水文气象和通量数据整合与共享的技术和方法论发展有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The establishment of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations since 2012 supports data collection. Automatic weather stations and systems such as the eddy covariance system provide half-hourly and 10-minute average data. The data processing involves steps like collection, processing, archiving, and sharing, with the dataset available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自2012年以来，建立了11个陆地表面通量和气象站以支持数据收集。自动气象站和涡度协方差系统提供每半小时和每10分钟的平均数据。数据处理包括收集、处理、归档和共享等步骤，数据集可从国家青藏高原数据中心获取。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might researchers expect challenges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems while collecting data in arid and semiarid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么研究人员在干旱和半干旱地区收集数据时可能会预期在维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡方面遇到挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges arise from ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in inland river basins in these regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 生态环境恶化带来了挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，尤其是在这些地区的内陆河流流域。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What expectations might researchers have regarding the availability and quality of long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 研究人员对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中长期观察数据集的可用性和质量可能会有什么期望？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Researchers might expect long-term observational datasets to be indispensable for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals, supporting ecological security, and ensuring sustainable development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 研究人员可能会认为，长期观测数据集对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，这对实现碳达峰和碳中和目标、支持生态安全以及确保绿洲的可持续发展具有重要意义。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be expected that advanced data collection methods are necessary for accurately capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么预计需要先进的数据收集方法来准确捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳通量？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Advanced data collection methods, such as eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, are necessary to accurately capture these metrics due to the complex interactions within oasis–desert systems and the need for high-resolution temporal data to inform quantitative understanding and ecological stability.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 先进的数据收集方法，如涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，是准确捕捉这些指标所必需的，因为绿洲-沙漠系统内的复杂相互作用以及需要高分辨率的时间数据来为定量理解和生态稳定性提供信息。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods utilized in observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换所采用的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods, which include an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for turbulent flux data, and automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data, offer a comprehensive approach. They allow for detailed long-term observations that are crucial for understanding the complex interactions in oasis–desert ecosystems, thereby supporting ecological stability and sustainable development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪用于湍流通量数据，以及自动气象站用于水文气象数据，提供了一种全面的方法。这些方法允许进行详细的长期观察，对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的复杂相互作用至关重要，从而支持生态稳定和可持续发展。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from oasis–desert ecosystems can be effectively collected to ensure long-term observation and analysis.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何有效地收集来自绿洲-沙漠生态系统的数据，以确保长期观察和分析。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data from oasis–desert ecosystems can be effectively collected using a suite of observational datasets that include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. These datasets are acquired through methods such as the eddy covariance system and scintillometer, alongside automatic weather stations that provide half-hourly and 10-minute averaged data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠生态系统的数据可以通过一系列观测数据集有效收集，这些数据集包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。这些数据集通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪等方法获取，同时自动气象站提供半小时和10分钟平均的数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the specific data processing techniques that ensure the quality and reliability of data collected from oasis–desert regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对确保从绿洲-沙漠地区收集的数据质量和可靠性的具体数据处理技术不太确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data processing techniques that ensure quality and reliability involve multiple steps: data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. These steps include quality control procedures such as data validation, filtering, and smoothing, which help to maintain the integrity of the datasets collected from oasis–desert regions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 确保质量和可靠性的 数据处理技术涉及多个步骤：数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享。这些步骤包括质量控制程序，如数据验证、过滤和平滑，这有助于维护从绿洲-沙漠地区收集的数据集的完整性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection techniques used for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结用于观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems involve a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural systems. Long-term datasets include energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, supplemented by hydrometeorological data, vegetation, and soil parameters. Half-hourly turbulent flux data are obtained using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. Hydrometeorological data such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature, air temperature, humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles are collected from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. Additionally, groundwater table data and other relevant parameters are included.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集技术涉及一系列来自人工和自然系统的观测数据集。长期数据集包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，辅以水文气象数据、植被和土壤参数。每半小时获取的湍流通量数据使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获得。水文气象数据如辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度、空气温度、湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量和土壤湿度剖面等数据由自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期收集。此外，还包括地下水位数据和其他相关参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the challenges faced in data collection for ecological monitoring in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域进行生态监测的数据收集面临的挑战包括：
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The challenges faced in data collection for ecological monitoring in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas include the crisis of ecological environment degradation. This manifests as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are particularly prevalent in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域进行生态监测的数据收集面临的挑战包括生态环境退化危机。这表现为河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域中尤为突出，如塔里木河流域、咸海流域和乌尔米湖流域。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that could be used to study the interactions between oasis and desert systems and their role in the global carbon cycle.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别潜在的数据集，这些数据集可以用于研究绿洲和沙漠系统之间的相互作用及其在全球碳循环中的作用。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying the interactions between oasis and desert systems and their role in the global carbon cycle include those from the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in western China. These datasets, freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, comprise energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations, as well as hydrometeorological data, vegetation, and soil parameters collected from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012, including 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用及其在全球碳循环中作用的潜在数据集包括来自中国西部黑河流域中下游的资料。这些数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取，包含能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据，以及自2012年以来在11个地表通量和气象站收集的水文气象数据、植被和土壤参数，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。
